/* Definition of 'cult' in popular culture */ Deleted it; this section contributed nothing besides a random factoid about what one author described a cult as.
I'm most definitely think that cults do exist, however Sfacets is right. The article does not in ''any'' way "show" that cults do exist, in fact the article documents the dispute over the subject.

The whole article shows that these opinions exist. Looking at your page, you are against the very existence of the cult category. Please find a page to edit that doesn't reflect a conflict of interest
"Cult" implies that a group is a cult, whereas there are mixed opinions. "so-called" shows that these opinions exist. Please discuss this further on the talkpage.

"so-called" implies that the default position is to doubt that the term applies. The point of the article is to clarify who refers to what groups as cults, not to prescribe a default position of doubt
rvt - that's nice, but POV is just slightly worse.
removed 7 uses of "so-called" - i hate wikipedia-speak

/* Connotative change */ requested citations for cult wars
/* Documented crimes */ m edit adding links
/* Points of view regarding definitions */ removed statement by UC member because we do not just cite everybody's primary source testimony from a court case
/* See also */ This "See also" list is very long, and includes specific cults. My opinion is that if a cult is significant enough to be here in this section, it should rather be in the article.
/* Cults and NRMs in literature */ It has been proposed that this section be moved to a new article, possibly named "[[Cults and new religious movements in literature, art, and popular culture]]".
/* Study of cults */ Trying to organize (help is welcome); deleted redundant paragraph.
/* Study of cults */ Do we need a "cult wars" section? Many citations are given: I'd suggest FACT tags instead of the banner for this section.
/* Societal and governmental pressures on cults */ [[Swadhyay Parivar]] has political clout?!? Removed until citation provided.
